title: Synthetic Recap
body:
**Cavaliers Obliterate Bulls Behind Price's Historic, Flawless Night**

CLEVELAND – In a stunning offensive clinic, the Cleveland Cavaliers delivered a commanding 101-80 victory over the Chicago Bulls, powered by a legendary and perfect performance from Mark Price that left the Chicago defense in tatters.

From the opening tip, Price was not just a facilitator; he was an unstoppable force of efficiency. The Cavaliers' guard authored one of the most remarkable shooting performances in league history, going a perfect 11-for-11 from the field. His 32 points were not just a game-high; they were a masterpiece of precision, leaving no room for error and no answer from the Bulls.

While Craig Ehlo provided valuable support with 16 points, the night belonged solely to Price. Every pull-up jumper, every drive to the lane, and every clutch three-pointer found nothing but net. His flawless execution dismantled the Bulls' defensive schemes and electrified the home crowd, turning a regular-season game into a historic event.

The Bulls, normally a powerhouse, were rendered helpless spectators to Price's brilliance. Michael Jordan led Chicago with 19 points, but his efforts were drowned out by the relentless efficiency of the Cavaliers' leader. As Price continued to pile on points without a single miss, the contest quickly transformed from a competition into a coronation.

On this night, Mark Price wasn't just the best player on the floor; he was a perfect one. His unprecedented 11-for-11 shooting display is the story, a statistical anomaly that propelled the Cavaliers to a decisive win and etched his name into the annals of NBA history.
